China flexes its trade muscles ...  from the Asian giant's economy. Australia's relationship with China soured in 2018 when the former banned the effectively Chinese state-owned company Huawei from its nascent 5G network. Despite American lobbying and cybersecurity fears, the European Union ruled out banning Huawei, leaving the decision to individual member countries. German operators Deutsche Telekom, Vodafone and Telefonica are all Huawei clients. German Chancellor Angela Merkel favors a level playing field for all providers, although some within her party favor banning the company. But when Germany debated Huawei, China's ambassador there threatened " consequences " if Germany excluded the telecoms giant from its market. Germany's hesitance to ban Huawei, likely due ...

A helping hand Likewise, it has been encouraging to see operators worldwide step up to assist their customers during the crisis, including: Initially, Telefonica Spain increased mobile plans by 30 GB per month for two months. When the lockdown continued, customers were given another 100 GB for an additional two months. In 2017 I started Impact Founders, a community of impact-driven entrepreneurs and regularly feature some of the most exciting founders in my Podcast, Impact Hustlers. Before becoming a full-time entrepreneur, I ran the London Programme of startup accelerator Wayra, working with a total of 180 portfolio companies, worked as a project manager for Telefonica in Munich & Dsseldorf and worked for the German Federal Foreign Office in South Africa.
